text:
(1)
A general view of lower Manhattan, as seen from the Brooklyn Bridge;, and showing the East River (foreground) converging at the upper Bay (left) with the Hudson (North) River. Notice Bedloe's Island between Manhattan and the Jersey shore line. See also views 2 and 3.
About 1870-1875.

Brown Brothers.

Published in the American on December 1908, and the New York Times of October 20, 1912.
title: General view - Manhattan - [View of Lower Manhattan from Brooklyn Bridge.]

text:
Bedloes Island: The Statue of Liberty enlightening the world, designed by Bartholdi and erected on a pedestal (paid for by popular subscription) by Richard M. Hunt, standing on an elevation formed by the walls of old Fort Wood and unveiled, October 1886.

The writer believes this photo to be the original of the illustration appearing on page 177 of King's Handbook of 1893.

Gift of Urbrock Collection
title: Islands - Bedloe's Island - [Statue of Liberty.]

title: North (Hudson) River - [River scenes - Sunset - Statue of Liberty.]

text:
Bedloe's Island: The Statue of Liberty, standing on an elevation in the center of an enclosed space made by the double walls of old Fort Wood. Designed by Bartholdi and the gift of France, it was unveiled in New York Harbor, October 1886. The pedestal was designed by Richard Hunt and erected under the supervision of General Stone. It cost 250000 and was paid for by popular subscription, mainly by the efforts of the "World".

About 1905

Pach Bros., photographers
REPRODUCTIONS RIGHTS UNKNOWN
title: Islands - Bedloe's Island - [Statue of Liberty - Old Fort Wood.]

text:
(1) Bedloe's Island (Statue of Liberty) in the Upper New York Bay, off the shore of Jersey City, New Jersey.

July 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same. Shown in the foreground are several Pennsylvania Railroad tugs hauling coal laden barges through the drifting ice.

February 17, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Bedloes Island: The Statue of Liberty by Frederic Bartoldis and presented to the United States as a gift of the French people.
Gift of Geo. D. Chinn
About 1925
pre 1907
title: Islands - Bedloe's Island - [View of the Statue of Liberty, a gift of the French people to the United States.]

text:
Bedloe's Island, south west, by south of Manhattan; formerly occupied by Fort Wood, commanding the Narrows, New York Bay. The Statue of Liberty, was erected upon the central parapet in 1886. Though Fort Wood has been come obsolete, the Island has acquired world fame, since the erection of the Statue.

About 1930.

Ewing Galloway.

Photostat Neg # 321
title: Islands - Bedloe's Island - [Statue of Liberty - The Narrows, New York Bay.]
